content.thinking:
The user wants to start an adventure. Looking at the context:

1. Character: Aric, Level 1 Fighter
2. Setting: A ruined observatory on a stormy night
3. Character creation is complete
4. User action is "Start Adventure"

I need to create an immersive opening scene that:
- Starts with time and location in the first sentence (Dawn/Day/Midnight etc with HH:MM:SS)
- Describes the ruined observatory setting
- Shows the stormy night atmosphere
- Gives the player (Aric, a practical ranger) something to react to
- Includes a planning block with choices

The game state shows Aric is a Level 1 Fighter with 12 HP. The character concept is "a practical ranger keeping watch at the frontier."

Let me craft an immersive opening scene.

content.text:
<final>
{
  "session_header": "[SESSION_HEADER]\nTimestamp: 1492 DR, Mirtul 15, 23:45:00\nLocation: Ruined Observatory, Frontier Outpost\nStatus: Lvl 1 Fighter | HP: 12/12 | XP: 0/300",
  "narrative": "The storm lashes against the crumbling stone walls of the observatory, rain streaming through shattered skylights above. Lightning flashes illuminate the ancient brass instruments scattered across the floor—twisted telescopes, cracked orrery gears, a massive meridian circle now lying in three pieces. Your watch post at the observatory's eastern archway offers a clear view of the frontier road below, though tonight the darkness swallows everything beyond thirty feet.\n\nThe wind carries the distant howl of something—a wolf, perhaps, or something else that prowls the frontier. You've seen lights in the ruins before. Flickering, unnatural. The locals say they're ghosts of astronomers who died here when the College collapsed. You know better than to believe ghost stories, but you also know better than to ignore what you've seen.\n\nA sound echoes from below—the scrape of metal on stone. Someone or something has breached the ground floor.",
  "planning_block": {
    "thinking": "Someone's in the observatory. Could be scavengers, could be something worse. I'm alone up here with a clear vantage point. I should assess before engaging—the rain masks sounds, but also limits visibility. I have the high ground if I stay put, but I lose the element of surprise if I wait too long.",
    "choices": {
      "hold_position": {
        "text": "Hold Position",
        "description": "Stay at the eastern archway, maintain the high ground, and wait for intruders to reveal themselves",
        "risk_level": "low"
      },
      "investigate_sound": {
        "text": "Investigate Sound",
        "description": "Move quietly toward the source of the noise to get a better idea of what you're facing",
        "risk_level": "medium"
      },
      "call_out": {
        "text": "Call Out",
        "description": "Announce your presence and demand identification from whoever is below",
        "risk_level": "high"
      }
    }
  },
  "resources": "HD: 1/1, Potions: 0, Exhaustion: 0",
  "action_resolution": {"reinterpreted": false, "audit_flags": []},
  "state_updates": {
    "world_data": {
      "world_time": {"hour": 23, "minute": 45, "second": 0, "day": 15, "month": "Mirtul", "year": 1492, "time_of_day": "Night"},
      "current_location": "Ruined Observatory"
    }
  },
  "entities_mentioned": ["Aric"],
  "location_confirmed": "Ruined Observatory"
}
</final>
